My thoughts and ideas

  • Description of a Pot Still

    General  · 29 Aug 2016

    A pot still is a type of still used in distilling spirits such as whisky or brandy. Heat is applied directly to the pot containing the wash (for whisky) or wine (for brandy).

  • History of the Alembic

    History, External sources  · 28 Aug 2016

    Dioscoridesâ€™ ambix (described in his De materia medica) is a helmet-shaped lid for gathering condensed mercury. For Athenaeus (~ 225 C.E.) it is a bottle or flask. For later chemists it denotes various parts of crude distillation devices.
